content.title: Common Pitfalls
content.explanation: Traps add fancy-sounding but unnecessary words, or keep redundant phrasing.
content.example: Sentence: 'Because it was raining, the ground was wet.' Trap: 'Due to the fact that it was raining, the ground was wet.'

content.title: 3-Step Process
steps: Step 1: Ask, 'What‚Äôs the author trying to say here?'
Step 3: Pick the clearest, most concise option that matches purpose.

content.title: Apply the Strategy
content.question: Which choice best improves the sentence‚Äôs clarity? 'The manager, who was in charge of overseeing the operations, led the meeting.'
choices: The manager in charge of overseeing operations led the meeting.
The manager, overseeing operations, was the one who led the meeting.

The manager, being the one in charge of overseeing the operations, led the meeting.
content.explanation: Choice C is concise and clear. A is wordy, B adds unnecessary phrasing, D is overly long.

content.title: Solution Walkthrough
solution_steps: Check A: 'in charge of overseeing' = wordy.
Check B: 'was the one who' = unnecessary.
